info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:14PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Otero, southeastern El Paso, Crowley and northeastern Pueblo Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 713 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 10 miles northeast of Pueblo Depot, or 25 miles east of Pueblo, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crowley, Ordway and Sugar City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern and east central Colorado.
